name_short_en.description: The short name of the country in English (for example 'Belgium').
name_short_en.title: Name Short En

name_official.description: The official name of the country (for example 'Kingdom of Belgium'). In English if available.
name_official.title: Name Official

iso3.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 code of the country (for example 'BEL').
iso3.title: Iso3

iso2.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the country (for example 'BE').
iso2.title: Iso2

iso3166_2.description: If the territory is a 'principal subdivision', its ISO 3166-2 code (for example 'BE-VLG').
iso3166_2.title: Iso3166 2

name.description: The name of the organisation publishing the data
name.title: Name

url.description: The url of the publisher's homepage.
url.title: Url

description.description: A brief description of the organisation publishing the data, including its mandate.
description.title: Description

countries_of_interest.description: A list of country IDs for which the publisher has data available.
countries_of_interest.title: Countries Of Interest

validity_period_start.description: The start of the range of time for which the regions are valid (inclusive)
validity_period_start.title: Validity Period Start

validity_period_end.description: The end of the range of time for which the regions are valid (inclusive). If the data is a single-day snapshot, this should be the same as `validity_period_start`.
validity_period_end.title: Validity Period End

level.description: The geography level contained in the file (e.g. output area, LSOA, MSOA, etc)
level.title: Level

hxl_tag.description: Humanitarian eXchange Language (HXL) description for the geography level
hxl_tag.title: Hxl Tag

human_readable_name.description: A human readable name for the metric, something like "Total Population under 12 years old"
human_readable_name.title: Human Readable Name

source_metric_id.description: The name of the metric that comes from the source dataset (for example in the ACS this might be "B001_E001" or something similar)
source_metric_id.title: Source Metric Id

description.description: A longer description of the metric which might include info on the caveats for the metric
description.title: Description

hxl_tag.description: Field description using the Humanitarian eXchange Language (HXL) standard
hxl_tag.title: Hxl Tag

metric_parquet_path.description: The path to the parquet file that contains the metric
metric_parquet_path.title: Metric Parquet Path

parquet_column_name.description: Name of column in the outputted parquet file which contains the metric
parquet_column_name.title: Parquet Column Name

parquet_margin_of_error_column.description: Name of the column if any that contains the margin of error for the metric
parquet_margin_of_error_column.title: Parquet Margin Of Error Column

parquet_margin_of_error_file.description: Location (url) of the parquet file that contains the margin of error for the metric
parquet_margin_of_error_file.title: Parquet Margin Of Error File

potential_denominator_ids.description: A list of metrics which are suitable denominators for this metric.
potential_denominator_ids.title: Potential Denominator Ids

parent_metric_id.description: Metric if any which is the parent to this one ( some census data like the ACS is organised hierarchically, this can be useful for making the metadata more searchable)
parent_metric_id.title: Parent Metric Id

source_data_release_id.description: The id of the data release from which this metric comes
source_data_release_id.title: Source Data Release Id

source_download_url.description: The url used to download the data from source.
source_download_url.title: Source Download Url

source_archive_file_path.description: (Optional), If the downloaded data is in an archive file (eg zip, tar, etc), this field is the path with the archive to locate the data file.
source_archive_file_path.title: Source Archive File Path

source_documentation_url.description: The documentation of the data release in human readable form.
source_documentation_url.title: Source Documentation Url

name.description: The name of the data release, as given by the publisher
name.title: Name

date_published.description: The date on which the data was published
date_published.title: Date Published

reference_period_start.description: The start of the range of time for which the data can be assumed to be valid (inclusive)
reference_period_start.title: Reference Period Start

reference_period_end.description: The end of the range of time for which the data can be assumed to be valid (inclusive). If the data is a single-day snapshot, this should be the same as `reference_period_start`.
reference_period_end.title: Reference Period End

collection_period_start.description: The start of the range of time during which the data was collected (inclusive)
collection_period_start.title: Collection Period Start

collection_period_end.description: The end of the range of time during which the data was collected (inclusive). If the data were collected in a single day, this should be the same as `collection_period_start`.
collection_period_end.title: Collection Period End

expect_next_update.description: The date on which is it expected that an updated edition of the data will be published. In some cases this will be the same as `reference_period_end`
expect_next_update.title: Expect Next Update

url.description: The url of the data release.
url.title: Url

data_publisher_id.description: The ID of the publisher of the data release
data_publisher_id.title: Data Publisher Id

description.description: A description of the data release
description.title: Description

geometry_metadata_id.description: The ID of the geometry metadata associated with this data release
geometry_metadata_id.title: Geometry Metadata Id
